intro: Chrysothamnus parryi subsp. asper, commonly known as the roughleaf goldenbush, is a shrub native to the western United States. It is characterized by its yellowish-green foliage and yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant has rough, hairy leaves that give it its subspecies name, "asper." It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils and open habitats. This subspecies is valued for its ornamental qualities and its ability to stabilize soils in dry landscapes.
